intro: Vaccinium haematinum, commonly known as the bloodberry viburnum, is a deciduous shrub native to eastern North America. It belongs to the Ericaceae family, which includes many acid-loving plants. The plant is characterized by its clusters of small, dark red berries that are edible and often used in culinary applications. Its leaves are elliptical and have a leathery texture, and it produces fragrant white flowers in the spring. The plant prefers moist, well-drained soils and is often found in woodland habitats.
